smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class BalanceFragment is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function onActivityResult appears to be too complex.
The function doInBackground appears to be too complex.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'BalanceFragment' with '32' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'MenuFragment' with '15' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'CounterFragment' with '19' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
File 'UXHelper.kt' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside files is set to '11'

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

smells.name: MatchingDeclarationName
smells.description: If a source file contains only a single non-private top-level class or object, the file name should reflect the case-sensitive name plus the .kt extension.

instances.message: The file name 'UXHelper.kt' does not match the name of the single top-level declaration 'SnackType'.
The file name 'ConnectionHelper.kt' does not match the name of the single top-level declaration 'ReturnCode'.
The file name 'ChartsHelper.kt' does not match the name of the single top-level declaration 'ChartStyle'.

smells.description: Using a spread operator causes a full copy of the array to be created before calling a method has a very high performance penalty.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

smells.name: SerialVersionUIDInSerializableClass
smells.description: A class which implements the Serializable interface does not define a correct serialVersionUID field. The serialVersionUID field should be a constant long value inside a companion object.

instances.message: The class User implements the Serializable interface and should thus define a serialVersionUID.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (x * (x * 0.062307 + 1.296347) - 2.190814) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: x * (x * 0.062307 + 1.296347) - 2.190814
Parentheses in (total.toFloat()/FOOD_RATIONS) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: total.toFloat()/FOOD_RATIONS
Parentheses in (-mSimpleRegression.intercept / mSimpleRegression.slope) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: -mSimpleRegression.intercept / mSimpleRegression.slope

smells.name: ReturnCount
smells.description: Restrict the number of return statements in methods.

instances.message: Function doInBackground has 4 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
